Package nl.pim16aap2.bigdoors.core.structures

Class StructureOpeningHelper

java.lang.Object
nl.pim16aap2.bigdoors.core.structures.StructureOpeningHelper
public final class StructureOpeningHelper extends Object
Represents a utility singleton that is used to open IStructures.
Author:
Pim

  • Method Details

    • canBreakBlocksBetweenLocs

      public boolean canBreakBlocksBetweenLocs(IStructureConst structure, Cuboid cuboid, IPlayer responsible)
      Checks if the owner of a structure can break blocks between 2 positions.

      If the player is not allowed to break the block(s), they'll receive a message about this.

      Parameters:
      structure - The IStructure being opened.
      cuboid - The area of blocks to check.
      responsible - Who is responsible for the action.
      Returns:
      True if the player is allowed to break the block(s).

    • isLocationEmpty

      public boolean isLocationEmpty(Cuboid newCuboid, Cuboid currentCuboid, @Nullable @Nullable IPlayer player, IWorld world)
      Checks if an area is empty. "Empty" here means that there no blocks that are not air or liquid.
      Parameters:
      newCuboid - The Cuboid representing the area the structure will take up after the toggle.
      currentCuboid - The Cuboid representing the area the structure currently takes up. Any parts of the new cuboid overlapping this cuboid will be ignored.
      player - The IPlayer to notify of violations. May be null.
      world - The world to check the blocks in.
      Returns:
      True if the area is not empty.

    • getBlocksInDir

      public int getBlocksInDir(Vector3Di vec, @Nullable @Nullable IPlayer player, IWorld world, Cuboid cuboid, int blocksToMove)
      Gets the number of blocks this structure can move in the given direction. If set, it won't go further than IDiscreteMovement.getBlocksToMove().

      TODO: This isn't used anywhere? Perhaps either centralize its usage or remove it.

      Parameters:
      vec - Which direction to count the number of available blocks in.
      player - The player for whom to check. May be null.
      world - The world to check the blocks in.
      cuboid - The Cuboid representing the area the structure currently takes up.
      blocksToMove - The number of blocks to try move.
      Returns:
      Gets the number of blocks this structure can move in the given direction.
